text: Atoms are 99.9999999% empty space.
The speed of thought is about 120 m/s.
The Earth weighs 6.6 sextillion tons.
Humans have about 100,000 hairs on their head.
The core of the Sun is 27 million degrees Fahrenheit.
Your heart beats about 100,000 times per day.
Alpha Centauri is 4.37 light years from Earth.
Adults breathe about 20,000 times per day.
The Andromeda galaxy is visible to the naked eye.
Your stomach acid has a pH of 1-2.
Gamma rays are the most energetic form of light.
The average person has about 5 liters of blood.
The event horizon is the point of no return in a black hole.
Tears contain antibodies that kill bacteria.
Pulsars can spin 716 times per second.
The human brain contains 86 billion neurons.
Quasars are the brightest objects in the universe.
Your body produces 200 billion red blood cells daily.
Neutron stars are born from supernova explosions.
The spinal cord is about 18 inches long.
White dwarfs are the remains of dead stars.
The pancreas produces about 1 liter of enzymes daily.
Dark matter makes up 27% of the universe.
The human skeleton weighs about 20% of body weight.
Dark energy makes up 68% of the universe.
Babies have about 300 bones at birth.
Only 5% of the universe is normal matter.
The gallbladder stores bile produced by the liver.
The Hubble Space Telescope orbits Earth every 97 minutes.
Your kidneys filter about 50 gallons of blood daily.
The James Webb Space Telescope is 1 million miles from Earth.
The appendix may serve as a safe house for gut bacteria.
Mars' atmosphere is 95% carbon dioxide.
Your heart valves open and close 100,000 times daily.
Venus' surface pressure is 90 times Earth's.
The thyroid gland controls metabolism.
Titan is the only moon with a thick atmosphere.
The pituitary gland is the size of a pea.
Europa may have an ocean under its ice.
The adrenal glands produce adrenaline.
Io is the most volcanically active body in the solar system.
The hypothalamus regulates body temperature.
Enceladus has geysers that spray water into space.
The cerebellum coordinates movement.
Triton orbits Neptune backwards.
The thalamus relays sensory information.
Ganymede is larger than Mercury.
The hippocampus is essential for memory.
Callisto is the most heavily cratered object in the solar system.
The amygdala processes emotions.
Charon is half the size of Pluto.
The brainstem controls breathing and heart rate.
The Kuiper Belt contains millions of icy objects.
The corpus callosum connects brain hemispheres.
The Oort Cloud is at the edge of the solar system.
The pineal gland produces melatonin.
Sedna takes 11,400 years to orbit the Sun.
The thymus gland shrinks after puberty.
Eris is larger than Pluto.
The pancreas has both endocrine and exocrine functions.
Makemake has no known moons.
The parathyroid glands regulate calcium.
Haumea spins so fast it's shaped like an egg.
The spleen filters blood and fights infection.
Ceres is the largest object in the asteroid belt.
The lymph nodes filter lymph fluid.
Vesta is the brightest asteroid from Earth.
Bone marrow produces blood cells.
Pallas is the third largest asteroid.
The retina contains 120 million rods and 6 million cones.
Hygiea is the fourth largest asteroid.
The cochlea is shaped like a snail shell.
Ryugu is a near-Earth asteroid studied by Hayabusa2.
The eardrum is only 0.1 mm thick.
Bennu is a potentially hazardous asteroid.
Earwax is actually a form of sweat.
67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko was explored by Rosetta.
The cornea has no blood vessels.
Halley's Comet last appeared in 1986.
The iris is a muscle that controls pupil size.
The Perseid meteor shower peaks every August.
The lens focuses light onto the retina.
The Geminid meteor shower is the strongest.
The optic nerve contains 1 million nerve fibers.
Meteors burn up about 50 miles above Earth.
The sclera is the white of the eye.
Most meteorites come from the asteroid belt.
The vitreous humor is 99% water.
The Chelyabinsk meteor was 20 meters across.
The aqueous humor nourishes the cornea.
The Tunguska event was likely a meteor airburst.
Tears have three layers.
Impact craters on Earth erode over time.
The lacrimal gland produces tears.
Meteor Crater in Arizona is 1 km wide.
Blinking spreads tears across the eye.
The Chicxulub crater is linked to dinosaur extinction.
The nasolacrimal duct drains tears into the nose.
Vredefort Crater is the largest known impact crater.
Yawning cools the brain.
